      • stringToWordSet

        private java.util.Set<java.lang.String> stringToWordSet(java.lang.String s)
        Takes a String, splits it by " " and returns the result as a Set.
        So if the String is "a b",
        The result will include two elements {a,b}.
        But the String "a a a"
        will just include one element {a}.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:

      • addVocabulary

        public void addVocabulary(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> voca)
        Description copied from interface: SpeechRecognition
        adds new vocabulary to this Speechrecognition module.
        Every String that contains " " will be splitted!
        If you want to be allowed to put whole phrases in the vocabulary,
        invoke the method phrasesAllowed(boolean allowed)
        Specified by:
        addVocabulary in interface SpeechRecognition
        Parameters:
        voca - the vocabulary to be added

        invoke the method phrasesAllowed(boolean allowed)
        Specified by:

      • recordWord

        public java.lang.String recordWord(int seconds,
                                   boolean prob)
        Description copied from interface: SpeechRecognition
        This method starts a recording session for a single word!
        The word must be in the vocabulary list getVocabulary().
        The (int seconds) parameter determines how long the module
        is listening to the user.
        The parameter will be normalized to the interval (0,1,...,9,10).
        It returns a word from the vocabulary that matches with
        the highest probability.
        If the parameter boolean prob is true,
        This method will return a whole sentence, that includes
        the word plus the probability that this word matched the speech.
        Otherwise it will just return the word with the highest probability.
        If a word can't be detected, this method will return null.
        Specified by:
        recordWord in interface SpeechRecognition
        Parameters:
        seconds - the window of time for the user to speak.
        prob - if this is true, this module will return a whole sentence with further infos
        Returns:
        The result as a String.

      • phrasesAllowed

        public void phrasesAllowed(boolean allowed)
        Description copied from interface: SpeechRecognition
        This method determines if whole phrases are allowed as vocabulary or not.
        If the parameter is true, phrases are allowed.
        Per default phrases are not allowed.
        This will not modify the vocabulary this instance of SpeechRecognition already knows!!
        Specified by:
        phrasesAllowed in interface SpeechRecognition
        Parameters:
        allowed - a boolean value that determins if whole phrases are allowed or not.
